words: The exchange of data between two or more devices through a transmission medium following specific rules (protocols).
Prepares the data for transmission and sends it.
A set of rules that govern data communication.
Protocols ensure compatibility between devices. Standards define specific protocols. Organizations like IEEE create and maintain these standards.
The number of signal events per second (not directly equivalent to bps).
A continuously varying signal representing data (e.g., sound wave).
A signal composed of discrete steps representing data (e.g., 0s and 1s).
Converting analog signals to digital for transmission.
Converting digital signals back to analog for use by devices.
Resource sharing, improved communication, reliability, cost-effectiveness.
Covers a small geographic area (e.g., office building).
Covers a large geographic area (e.g., the internet).
Covers a metropolitan area (e.g., city-wide network).
Dedicated server provides resources to client devices.
